Codes: elm:value[elm:Code]: [398166005 |Performed (qualifier value)|]elm:value[elm:Code]: [[370851004 |Evaluation of diagnostic study results (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[40701008 |Echocardiography (procedure)]]
High-Risk Findings on Electrocardiogram (ECG) Stress Test (e.g., Duke Treadmill Score <-12, Ventricular Tachycardia, Prolonged ST-Segment Depression, or Exercise-Induced Hypotension)(TSR-NoCode)

High-Risk Findings on Imaging Stress Test (e.g., >10% Ischemic Myocardium on Nuclear Perfusion Imaging, Stress-Induced Wall Motion Abnormality in >= 2 Segments on Echocardiography, Transient Ischemic Dilation, or Stress-Induced Left Ventricular Dysfunction)(TSR-NoCode)

Resting Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) <41% and Viable Myocardium in Dysfunctional Segment (Reversible Ischemia) on Imaging Stress Test(000ca427-81f2-4af6-829e-06fa21957039 |Cardiovascular stress diagnostic imaging procedure (procedure) ->(363714003 |Interprets (attribute))->[250908004 |Left ventricular ejection fraction (observable entity)])
Symptomatic Patient with High Pretest Probability of coronary artery disease and No Prior Noninvasive Stress Imaging(TSR-NoCode)

Symptomatic Patient with Intermediate-Risk Findings on Imaging Stress Test (5% to 10% Ischemic Myocardium on Nuclear Perfusion Imaging or Stress-Induced Wall Motion Abnormality in 1 Segment on Echocardiography)(TSR-NoCode)
Symptomatic Patient with Discordant or Equivocal/Uninterpretable Findings on Imaging Stress Test(TSR-NoCode)
Symptomatic Patient with New Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVEF =;<40%) of Unknown Etiology on Transthoracic Echocardiography(TSR-NoCode)
Symptomatic Patient with Suspected Significant Ischemic Complication of CAD on Transthoracic or Transesophageal Echocardiography (e.g., Mitral Regurgitation or Ventricular Septal Defect)(TSR-NoCode)
Symptomatic Patient with Any Lesion >= 50% on Coronary Computed Tomography (CT) Angiography(TSR-NoCode)
Symptomatic Patient with Possibly Obstructive Lesion of Unclear Severity on Coronary CT Angiography(TSR-NoCode)
Medically Managed Patient with Limiting or Worsening Symptoms and Noninvasive Findings of Intermediate Risk that have worsened(TSR-NoCode)
Medically Managed Patient and High-Risk Noninvasive Findings(TSR-NoCode)
Post revascularization (PCI or CABG) Patient with Limiting or Worsening Symptoms and Intermediate-Risk Noninvasive Findings(TSR-NoCode)
Post revascularization Patient with Limiting or Worsening Symptoms and High-Risk Noninvasive Findings(TSR-NoCode)
Return of Spontaneous Circulation after Resuscitated Cardiac Arrest of Unclear Etiology
Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia of Unclear Etiology
Pulmonary Hypertension Disproportionate to Valvular Disease
Left Ventricular Dysfunction Disproportionate to Valvular Disease
Conflict between Findings of Noninvasive Imaging for Mitral or Aortic Stenosis or Regurgitation and Clinical Impression of Severity
Suspected or Uncertain Constrictive or Restrictive Pericardial Disease
Reevaluation of Known Cardiomyopathy to Guide Therapy or after Change in Clinical Status or Exam
Possible Percutaneous Coronary Intervention, Angioplasty, and Stent

Display Text
If a code is used multiple times in the KNART, only the display text of the first instance is shown.

References
Count of the number of times the given code system and code pair is used in the KNART.

000ca427-81f2-4af6-829e-06fa21957039 |Cardiovascular stress diagnostic imaging procedure (procedure) ->(363714003 |Interprets (attribute))->[250908004 |Left ventricular ejection fraction (observable entity)]
Resting Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) <41% and Viable Myocardium in Dysfunctional Segment (Reversible Ischemia) on Imaging Stress Test
Adult patients with suspected cardiac disease requiring invavise diagnosis and/or treatment

TSR-NoCode
TSR-NoCode is a placeholder indicating a code was requested, but was not provided.
High-Risk Findings on Electrocardiogram (ECG) Stress Test (e.g., Duke Treadmill Score <-12, Ventricular Tachycardia, Prolonged ST-Segment Depression, or Exercise-Induced Hypotension)
[370851004 |Evaluation of diagnostic study results (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[268400002 |12 lead electrocardiogram (procedure)]
[370851004 |Evaluation of diagnostic study results (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[399208008 |Plain chest X-ray (procedure)]
Stage 1 (Glomerular Filtration Rate >= 90 mL/min per 1.73 m^2)
Stage 2 (Glomerular Filtration Rate 60 to 89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2)
Stage 4 (Glomerular Filtration Rate 15 to 29 mL/min per 1.73 m^2)
Stage 3 (Glomerular Filtration Rate 30 to 59 mL/min per 1.73 m^2)
Stage 5 (Glomerular Filtration Rate < 15 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 or on dialysis)

A group of related alternative actions is a sentence group if the item referenced by the action is the same in all the actions, and each action simply constitutes a different variation on how to specify the details for that item. For example, two actions that could be in a SentenceGroup are "aspirin, 500 mg, 2 times per day" and "aspirin, 300 mg, 3 times per day". In both cases, aspirin is the item referenced by the action, and the two actions represent two different options for how aspirin might be ordered for the patient. Note that a SentenceGroup would almost always have an associated selection behavior of "AtMostOne", unless it's a required action, in which case, it would be "ExactlyOne".
A group with this behavior logically groups its sub-elements, and may be shown as a visual group to the end user, but it is not required to do so.
Any group marked with this behavior should be displayed as a visual group to the end user.
Any number of the items in the group may be chosen, from zero to all.
All the items in the group must be selected as a single unit.
All the items in the group are meant to be chosen as a single unit: either all must be selected by the end user, or none may be selected.
The end user must choose one and only one of the selectable items in the group. The user may not choose none of the items in the group.
The end user may choose zero or at most one of the items in the group.
The end user must choose a minimum of one, and as many additional as desired.
An action with this behavior must be included in the actions processed by the end user; the end user may not choose not to include this action.
An action with this behavior may be included in the set of actions processed by the end user.
An action with this behavior must be included in the set of actions processed by the end user, unless the end user provides documentation as to why the action was not included.

An action with this behavior is one of the most frequent actions that is, or should be, included by an end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the action to the end user should consider "pre-checking" such an action as a convenience for the user.

An action with this behavior is one of the less frequent actions included by the end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the actions to the end user would typically not "pre-check" such an action.
An action with this behavior may only be completed once.
An action with this behavior may be repeated multiple times.
This item, in a list entry, allows the user to enter a fill in value that is not present in the set of presented choices.
For a particular action or action group, specifies whether the elements are read only.
